page.title: 04Tourism, Caravans: Pateley
page.content: Tourism creates a great deal of employment in this area. One of the amenities needed by tourists is a caravan site. We have two large ones: one by the river Nidd in Pateley Bridge and one up by Heathfield. The site near Pateley is run as a family business and covers an area of ten acres. One of the jobs on the site is to book in the campers as they arrive. It is also necessary to make sure the campsite is tidy and to answer any questions the campers may ask. The site is used by families who enjoy the scenery and the walks around here. Walkers or hikers, who are walking the Yorkshire Way, sometimes stay overnight. There are two areas in the campsite. One is for static caravans, which are there all year round, and the other is for people who come with their own tents or caravans.
